 Our Mission:   We aim to address food insecurity across Montclair State University. The Red Hawk Pantry is open to all students, staff, and faculty at no cost. If you are unable to visit during our regular hours, please reach out via email at redhawkpantry@montclair.edu Stay updated by following us on Instagram: @montclair_redhawkpantry

title: American Dream Mall Trip
description:
Join Campus Activities for a fun-filled  Labor Day trip to American Dream Mall ! Explore one of the largest entertainment and shopping destinations in the U.S., featuring shops, dining, an indoor amusement park, water park, and more. Whether you're looking to relax, shop, or have an adventure, there's something for everyone. 
   
 How do I sign up/attend? 
 
 
 This trip is first come, first serve. We are limited up to the first 275 students who show up.  
 FREE for students with a valid Montclair State ID 
 All students are welcome! 
 
 
   
 
 This is limited to the first 275 participants. Buses will be running on a loop from Red Hawk Deck to the American Dream Mall starting at 11am. 
 
   
 Where and when? 
 
 
 Monday, September 1st 
 11 am - 6 pm 
 American Dream Mall, East Rutherford, New Jersey 
 
 
   
 
 Buses will be leaving campus from  Red Hawk Deck  periodically, so you can choose a departure time that works best for you. Refer to the schedule below. 
 
   
 Drop off times: 
 11:00am dropoff 12:00pm dropoff 1:00pm dropoff 
 Pickup times: 
 4:00pm pickup 5:00pm pickup 
 6:00pm pickup 
 
 Students may need to Uber/ Lyft back to campus if they miss the shuttles back. It is approximately 10 miles away.

title: Embed Library Resources in Canvas
description:
In this hands-on session, you'll learn how to quickly and easily embed library resources such as databases, journals, e-books, articles and streaming video into your Canvas course. We'll walk you through permalinking and creating persistent links to prompt your students to log in and access library content hassle-free. We'll also cover adding a librarian to your course and demonstrate the Library Resources tab in Canvas. 
 
 Related LibGuide:  Canvas and Library Integration by Bill Vincenti 
 Register Here:  https://montclair.libcal.com/event/14642677

title: Hawk Crossings Community Meeting
description:
Join the CAs for the Hawk Crossings Community Meeting! This is your opportunity to connect with your fellow residents as well as learning the important information about living on campus, including the Hawk Crossings community expectations, upcoming events, resources, and ways to get involved. 
 Residents will have the chance to ask questions, share feedback, and meet others in the building. Attendance is highly encouraged! 
 This event is for Residents of Hawk Crossings.

title: Freeman and Russ Hall Community Meeting
description:
Event Description: Join us for the Freeman and Russ Hall Community Meeting! This is your opportunity to connect with your Professional Staff, student staff, and fellow residents as we kick off the semester together. At this meeting, we’ll cover important information about living in Freeman and Russ, including community expectations, upcoming events, resources, and ways to get involved. 
 Residents will also have the chance to ask questions, share feedback, and meet others in the building. Attendance is encouraged to stay up-to-date and make the most out of your living experience on campus. 
 What to Expect: 
 
 
 Important updates about Freeman and Russ Hall 
 
 
 Resources and support available to you 
 
 
 Opportunities to connect with staff and peers 
 
 
 A chance to ask questions and share your voice 
 
 
 We look forward to seeing you there! 
 This event is for Freeman and Russ residents.

organization: The John Martinson Honors EDGE Program
description:
Hi Honors Scholars, 
 Welcome to Montclair! Please join us for the New Honors Student Orientation on Wednesday, September 3 at 2:00 PM - 4pm in CELS 120. 
 In this session, you’ll meet Honors staff and student leaders, get a quick program overview (including our EDGE pillars), hear from a student panel, and learn about key resources (Canvas, Engage, tutoring, mentoring), plus a short community-building activity. Refreshments will be served!  
 Please RSVP TODAY! 
 We’re excited to see you there!

title: Simplify Your Content Creation Workflow
organization: Feliciano Center for Entrepreneurship and Innovation
description:
Create Content That Truly Connects ✨ 
 Discover how to streamline your content process from ideation to publication. Learn proven systems for batch creation, repurposing strategies that multiply your content's reach, and automation tools that work behind the scenes so you don't have to. We'll tackle the biggest productivity killers – from perfectionism paralysis to platform overwhelm – and give you actionable frameworks to create sustainable content rhythms that actually stick.

title: Rec Fest
description:
Get Ready for  Rec Fest: Recess Edition ! 
   
 It's time to take a break, play hard, and relive your favorite playground games at  Rec Fest: Recess Edition!  Come join the fun on Thursday, September 4 from 1-3pm at the Student Recreation Center and explore everything the Student Recreation Center has to offer this fall—from intramural and club sports to  fitness classes to swim lessons to unforgettable adventure trips AND PICKLEBALL! 
   
 Jump into classic games like 4 Square, Dodgeball, Knock Out, and more. Plus, we will have caricature/airbrush/tattoo artists, food and ice cream!  Enter for your chance to win awesome prizes, including the GRAND PRIZE = a pair of  Apple AirPods Max ! Don't miss out on the best way to kick off your semester at the Student Rec Center. 
   
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Registration is not required 
 FREE for students with a valid Montclair State ID 
 
 Where and when? 
 
 September 4, 2025 
 1pm - 3pm 
 Student Recreation Center Gym 
 
 Prizes 
 Aquatics Pack:   Swim Fins, Mask, Snorkel, Gear Bag ,  Go Pro snorkeling Mask , Towel 
 EQC Pack:  MSU Sweatpants, Sweatshirt, tank top, shorts, Headphones,  JBL Speaker 
 Sports Pack:  Football (MSU),  fit bit , Montclair Flag,  Gym bag ,  Massage gun ,  Yoga mat ,  protein shaker

title: Kayaking
description:
Enjoy a relaxing day paddling down the Delaware River and learn some basic kayaking skills. Trip leaves from Montclair Recreation Center and Kayaks start from Frenchtown, NJ, this full-day trip will provide you with a chance to enjoy the warm, clear waters of the longest undammed river east of the Mississippi. We provide the boats, life jackets and paddles, but be prepared to get wet. 
   
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Register online through Fusion, in the Student Recreation Center's main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost for Students $10 
 
   
 Where and when? 
 
 Saturday, September 6, 2025 
 9:00 am - 6:00 pm 
 Begins at Student Recreation Center 
 
   
 What to bring:  Water, lunch, bathing suit, towel, sunblock and a change of clothes. 
   
 Potential Hazards:  under/above water obstructions, rapidly moving water, poisonous plants/allergies, insect bites, unpredictable weather changes, sunburn/heat exhaustion, dehydration.

title: American Heart Association Heartsaver Adult/Child/Infant (ages 1 month and above) CPR/AED Class - Hosted by EMS (Lt. Matias)
description:
The HeartSaver CPR AED Course is designed for anyone with little or no medical training who needs a course completion card for their job, regulatory compliance (e.g., OSHA), or other requirements, or anyone who wants to be prepared for an emergency in any setting.  
 Class details: 
 
 Class fee includes the cost of certification by the American Heart Association and student manual e-book 
 You must register and pay for the class in advance.  
 This class is best for educators and the general public. 
 This is  NOT  a BLS CPR certification for first responders or healthcare providers. 
 Class duration is approximately 2.5-3 hours. 
 Please wear comfortable clothing. 
 Bring a water bottle 
 
 REFUND, RESCHEDULING & NO-SHOW POLICIES:   
 By registering for your class, you agree to the following policies:  
 REFUNDS:  Course fees will only be refunded when registration is canceled at least 72 hours prior to the class start time. If registration is canceled within 72 hours of class start time, students will be given an opportunity to attend another class, with a maximum of two (2) rescheduled classes.  
 NO SHOWS/MISSED CLASS:  Course fees are not refunded for no-shows. You will forfeit your course fee if you do not reschedule your course within 7 days of the original class. If you miss your class, you have up to 7 days to reschedule to another class by contacting the EMS office. 
 Please contact ems@montclair.edu with any questions.  
 Adult + Child + Infant CPR/AED: $70. Click here to pay:  https://secure.touchnet.net/C27528_ustores/web/product_detail.jsp?PRODUCTID=442&SINGLESTORE=true

title: Organizing Research

title: Cali School of Music Midweek Concert: Cali Artist-in-Residence Leyla McCalla
description:
Cali Midweek Concert with 2025-26 Cali Artist-in-Residence Leyla McCalla Leshowitz Recital Hall, Chapin Hall, Cali School of Music FREE, no tickets required 
 Leyla McCalla  is a multi-instrumentalist, multilingual singer and songwriter who combines original compositions and traditional Haitian tunes. Producing a distinctive sound that reflects the union of her roots and experience, McCalla’s performances are captivating, fueled by rich, sophisticated melodic work and intoxicating Afro-Caribbean rhythms. McCalla was born to a pair of Haitian emigrants and activists, first rising to success with the GRAMMY-winning  Carolina Chocolate Drops  before launching her solo career in 2014. The New York Times described her voice as “disarmingly natural, and her settings elegantly succinct,” while Rolling Stone hailed her “politically pointed lyrics.” Besides her own projects, McCalla currently performs in  Our Native Daughters , alongside  Rhiannon Giddens . 
 Photo by Chris Scheurich 
 ---------- 
 Cali Midweek Concerts 2025-26 Most Wednesdays at 2 PM Chapin Hall, Leshowitz Recital Hall 
 FREE ADMISSION! 
 Join us for the  Cali Midweek Concerts  at  Montclair State University’s John J. Cali School of Music , where we bring a diverse array of musical performances and educational events every Wednesday at 2PM in Leshowitz Recital Hall, Chapin Hall. Our concert series showcases the immense talent within our faculty, students, and esteemed guest artists. 
 FULL SCHEDULE:  https://www.montclair.edu/music/cali-midweek-series-schedule/

title: Cali School of Music: Masterclass and Performance: Luisma Gonzalez Jiminez, saxophone
description:
(Reservations not required) 
 Materclass and performance:  Luisma Gonzalez Jiminez, saxophone 
 Luisma Gonzalez Jimenez will be presenting a masterclass featuring Cali saxophone students as well as a performance. Luis María González  is an award-winning Spanish saxophonist and educator whose international career spans performances at  Carnegie Hall, Théâtre du Châtelet,  and the  Palau de la Música Catalana , alongside acclaimed recordings with his  Gaman Ensemble . A dedicated scholar and pedagogue, he combines his roles as professor at the  Conservatoire Marcel Dupré  in Paris, soloist with the  Almería Symphonic Orchestra , and researcher in musicology and neuropsychology at the  University of Granada .

title: 9/11 National Day of Service & Remembrance 2025
organization: Office of Community Engagement and Partnerships
description:
✨ United We stand, Together We Serve! ✨ 
 YOU MUST REGISTER FOR THIS EVENT ON EVENTZILLA 
 The 9/11 National Day of Service is long standing tradition at Montclair State University that honors the lives lost and heroic acts of September 11, 2001. Our volunteers commemorate the day through meaningful service projects that foster unity, civic responsibility, leadership, and often inspire long-term community engagement. Come join us for a day of giving back! 
 Volunteers will have the opportunity to choose from 30+ service sites, both on and off campus, and engage in community service projects. 
 
   
 Check out this list of service sites for more in-depth information about our partners! 
   
 
 Here’s what you can expect: 
 
 ⏰ Registration  at 8:00 - 8:45 AM. Event starts at  8:45 AM 
 🚌  Transportation provided  to and from off-campus sites 
 🥯  Free breakfast and lunch  to fuel your day 
 ⏳  Service hours  validation (for students/groups that need it) 
 👕 Exclusive 9/11 Day of Service T-Shirt 
 🧑‍🎓 Bloomfield College  students will have a shuttle service provided 
 🎊 Icebreaker activities, games, giveaways, and a DJ! 
 More details to be given once you sign up for a slot 
 
   
 IMPORTANT NOTE:  You can only sign up for  one  service site due to each project running simultaneously. We will email you after registration if other information is needed for your site.

title: High Point Monument Moderate Hike
description:
Join Outdoor Adventure for this relatively short but steep hike up to High Point Monument, at 1,803 feet above sea level. You will be rewarded with a spectacular panorama of farmlands, forests, hills and valleys of three states. 
   
 How do I sign-up? 
 
 Register online through Fusion, in the Student Recreation Center's main office, or over the phone (973-655-3340). 
 Cost for Students $10 
   
 
 Where and when? 
 
 Sunday, September 14, 2025 
 10:00 am - 5:00 pm  
 Begins at Student Recreation Center 
 
   
 What to bring:  Water, lunch, weather-appropriate clothing, boots or sneakers, and sunscreen. 
   
 Potential Hazards:  Poisonous plants/allergies; insect bites; unpredictable weather changes; sunburn/heat exhaustion; dehydration; steep, rocky and/or slippery terrain; rolling or falling rocks; snakes and large animals; and injuries including sprains/strains, abrasions, lacerations and fractures.

title: Meet the artist at the University Galleries' fall 2025 opening reception!
location: George Segal Gallery | Alexander Kasser Theater Lobby
description:
Join us in celebrating the opening of the Montclair State University Galleries' Fall 2025 exhibition:  The Age of Black Metal by  Afrotectopia. Remarks by the artist and curator Ari Melenciano and Dean Gurskis at 6 pm in the  Segal Gallery , located on the fourth floor of the Red Hawk Deck.  Register for free here! 
 ABOUT THE EXHIBITION 
 September 9 – December 14, 2025 
 Segal Gallery and Kasser Lobby 
 Black Metal  originated as a kitchen table art book that pushes the boundaries of space travel, science fiction, speculative design, Black culture, art, technology, and spirituality. The book emerged from an Afrotectopia-led incubator, in collaboration with MIT Media Lab’s Space Exploration Initiative and NYU’s Interactive Telecommunications Program. The project features contributions from artists Jordan Caldwell, Kordae Jatafa Henry, Jeremy Kamal, and Ari Melenciano. 
 The Age of Black Metal  builds upon the foundational ideas of the book and translates the text into a fully immersive experience for visitors to explore each conceptual chapter–from metaphysical training manuals, botanical consciousness, and self-alignment protocols–through participatory installations. The exhibition is set centuries in the future, imagining a timeline where society has been profoundly shaped by the principles of Black Metal. Ultimately, visitors will not only bear witness to the societal effects of Black Metal, but also leave transformed in some way. 
 The Age of Black Metal  invites all to imagine the futures that Black culture can build, if given space to expand without limit. 
 Ari Melenciano  has cultivated an expansive practice within the arts, technology, design, culture, and pedagogy. Her natural ability to combine many disciplines reveals their interconnectedness and reimagines their conventions for new possibilities. Her art practice ranges from using AI through both critical and imaginative lenses, to sound design using botanical data. Her work has been exhibited around the world from Dubai's Museum of the Future to the Studio Museum in Harlem. She's a frequent international public speaker, and occasionally designs and teaches courses at New York University, Hunter College, Parsons, and the Pratt Institute. 
 Afrotectopia  is a social institution cultivating boundless innovation at the nexus of art, design, technology, and culture. Founded in 2018 by NYU ITP graduate student Ari Melenciano, Afrotectopia began as a highly cross-disciplinary conference cultivating a vibrant community of industry and cultural pioneers. For years, Afrotectopia hosted a variety of programming that bridged connections between emerging technologies, Black culture, and racial equity.

title: Cali School of Music Midweek Series: Musician's Health Lecture with Jennifer Johnson
description:
Cali Midweek Series: Musician's Health Lecture with Jennifer Johnson  
 Music, Movement & Transformation: The Body Mapping Story  - a Jennifer Johnson film that documents the vision, wisdom, and compassion of Body Mapping founder Barbara Conable, and delves into the compelling stories of musicians whose lives have been profoundly changed for the better.   "What everyone needed to learn about body movement in kindergarten... but didn't!"  Body Mapping helps musicians to move according to the design of their bodies to enhance technique and address and prevent playing-related injuries. 
 Bio: Violinist, teacher, and author  Jennifer Johnson  is an internationally sought-after master teacher in Body Mapping (BMG) and renowned for her expertise in helping musicians to move according to the design of their bodies to address and prevent playing-related injuries. She has been on faculty of the  New York Philharmonic ’s Zarin Mehta Program and has presented BMG workshops to music organizations world-wide including The  Finnish National Opera  and  The Tuckamore Chamber Music Festival . In 2015 she was keynote speaker at the  Australian Strings’ Association 2015 Conference , and in October 2019 she was a guest of J uilliard’s Noa Kageyama on the Bulletproof Musician podcast.  Jennifer was also featured on Renée-Paule Gauthier’s  Mind Over Finger  podcast in the fall of 2022 and was invited to teach BMG at the  Starling-Delay Violin Symposium at Juilliard  in May 2023.

title: Audiology (AuD) Virtual Information Session
description:
Take your research to the next level Our  Audiology program  is designed to empower you to excel in multiple roles—clinician, educator, administrator, and researcher. 
 
 As a clinician, you'll be able to identify the hearing health needs of individuals and design, implement and evaluate treatment plans to meet those needs.  
 In education, you'll be equipped to share your knowledge and inspire others in community healthcare settings. 
 As an administrator, you'll learn to lead, innovate, and elevate audiology services across diverse environments. 
 And with a strong foundation in research, you'll be ready to explore new frontiers in audiology, applying cutting-edge insights directly to your practice. 
 
 Join us for a virtual information session September 17 at 7:00 PM (EST)  to become a versatile leader in the dynamic field of audiology, where your impact can resonate for a lifetime.

 We're hosting a  virtual information session on September 22  at 6:00 PM . This is a no-pressure, exploratory space to meet our team and determine if our program fits your goals.

title: Art Forum with Ari Melenciano
description:
Art Forum is a speaker series featuring artists, designers, art historians, curators, and art critics from around the world presenting their work and ideas in an open forum, hosted by the Department of Art & Design. Artist and curator Ari Melenciano will discuss her latest work in  The Age of Black Metal  by Afrotectopia.  Register on Eventbrite 
 
 
   
 ABOUT THE EXHIBITION 
 September 9 – December 14, 2025 
 Segal Gallery and Kasser Lobby 
 Curated by Ari Melenciano 
 Black Metal  originated as a kitchen table art book that pushes the boundaries of space travel, science fiction, speculative design, Black culture, art, technology, and spirituality. The book emerged from an Afrotectopia-led incubator, in collaboration with MIT Media Lab’s Space Exploration Initiative and NYU’s Interactive Telecommunications Program. The project features contributions from artists Jordan Caldwell, Kordae Jatafa Henry, Jeremy Kamal, and Ari Melenciano. 
 The Age of Black Metal  builds upon the foundational ideas of the book and translates the text into a fully immersive experience for visitors to explore each conceptual chapter–from metaphysical training manuals, botanical consciousness, and self-alignment protocols–through participatory installations. The exhibition is set centuries in the future, imagining a timeline where society has been profoundly shaped by the principles of Black Metal. Ultimately, visitors will not only bear witness to the societal effects of Black Metal, but also leave transformed in some way. 
 The Age of Black Metal  invites all to imagine the futures that Black culture can build, if given space to expand without limit. 
 Ari Melenciano  has cultivated an expansive practice within the arts, technology, design, culture, and pedagogy. Her natural ability to combine many disciplines reveals their interconnectedness and reimagines their conventions for new possibilities. Her art practice ranges from using AI through both critical and imaginative lenses, to sound design using botanical data. Her work has been exhibited around the world from Dubai's Museum of the Future to the Studio Museum in Harlem. She's a frequent international public speaker, and occasionally designs and teaches courses at New York University, Hunter College, Parsons, and the Pratt Institute. 
 Afrotectopia  is a social institution cultivating boundless innovation at the nexus of art, design, technology, and culture. Founded in 2018 by NYU ITP graduate student Ari Melenciano, Afrotectopia began as a highly cross-disciplinary conference cultivating a vibrant community of industry and cultural pioneers. For years, Afrotectopia hosted a variety of programming that bridged connections between emerging technologies, Black culture, and racial equity.

title: Safe Space Training
description:
Our Safe Space Training is an intensive, interactive training that provides attendees with information and tools to combat homophobia, biphobia, transphobia, cissexism and heterosexism, on campus and beyond. Through interactive activities and discussion, participants will personally reflect on their own experiences to enhance their personal and professional development, provide further education, and finally, identify ways to create change on campus and beyond. 
 All sessions are three hours and are first-come, first-served. Pre-registration is required. Registrants are expected to attend the full session. Only individuals who have fully completed the Safe Space Program and have agreed to the expectations of its membership are able to display the sticker/button of our program. Refreshments are not provided; however, you are more than welcome to bring your lunch, coffee, snacks, etc.

title: Button Up for the Ballot!
description:
We’re inviting all students, faculty, and staff to stop by and design your very own  “Why I Vote”  or political campaign-style button that shows off your personality and civic pride. Whether you’re passionate about making your voice heard, standing up for your community, or just love a creative project, this event is the perfect blend of fun and purpose. 
   
 We’ll provide all the supplies—buttons, markers, stencils, and stickers—you bring the ideas! While you’re here, get the latest info on the upcoming election, key deadlines, and how YOU can be part of shaping our democracy. It’s informative, it’s creative, and it’s open to everyone. Let’s make civic engagement bold, bright, and buttoned up!

title: Getting Started with EndNote
description:
Using a citation manager like EndNote to organize your references has numerous advantages, including but not limited to... 
 
 Collect references as you browse the web or databases 
 Organize, highlight, and annotate your PDFs, all in one place 
 Sync between your devices 
 Automatically rename PDF files you've downloaded 
 Generate citations instantly and change style formats with a few clicks 
 
 This is a hands-on workshop, so please bring your laptop with you. By the end of this workshop, you will be able to import your existing references into the program, collect references from the library databases, and be able to generate citations using the "Cite While You Write" plugin. 
 If you can, please download the EndNote installation files in advance from the  Software Repository . 
 
 Related LibGuide:  EndNote by Siobhan McCarthy 
 Register Here:  https://montclair.libcal.com/event/15187313

title: Kinesiology (MS) Virtual Information Session
description:
Take your career to the next level in Kinesiology Looking to pivot your career into the high-growth fields of health, fitness, and wellness? Montclair State University’s Kinesiology (MS) can help you make the leap into exciting new roles where you can make a real difference. This program offers two concentrations: 
 
 The  Concentration in Exercise Science  is designed to cultivate knowledge in specialized and applied areas of exercise physiology and biomechanics. Students may further finetune their study through elective offerings in exercise programming, cardiac rehabilitation, neuromotor physiology, coaching techniques and sport psychology.  
 
 
 The  Concentration in Sport Administration  is designed to cultivate knowledge and skills needed to work in various facets of the sport industry. The program features a strong core in Sport Administration with options to take additional coursework in Athletic Administration (for certified teachers seeking the Supervisory Certificate), Coaching, and Sport Business.  
 
 Register for our virtual information session September 24 at 6:00 PM (EST) . Meet our expert faculty who equip students with key skills to excel professionally.

description:

 Learn about local races, statewide initiatives, and key issues that directly impact your community. Whether you’re a first-time voter or just need a quick refresher, our team will be on hand to answer your questions and walk you through the ballot in a simple, stress-free way. 
 This is your chance to feel confident and prepared before heading to the polls. Grab a guide, ask your questions, and empower yourself to make informed choices on Election Day!

title: AEW: MAJOR KICKOFF
description:
Major Kickoff is the bold new evolution of University College’s signature event, formerly known as  Major Madness . This high-energy, campus-wide kickoff transforms the traditional majors fair into an interactive and dynamic experience that sets the tone for major exploration for University College students.  Major Kickoff  serves as a central hub where students can dive into the wide array of majors offered at Montclair in a fun and engaging way. Students will engage with peers, faculty, and staff; discover pathways to get involved in various programs; and gain the guidance they need to make confident, informed decisions about their major. With the opportunity to declare a major on the spot,  Major Kickoff  empowers students to take charge of their academic journey. 
 With over 50 departments, programs, clubs, and more on site, you never know what you might discover or who you might meet.  Enjoy free food, games, music, and giveaways, win prizes and T-shirts (yes, you'll be able to tie-dye them) , and maybe even find your future major. 
 Event Details:  📅 Date: Monday, September 29th, 2025 🕒 Time: 1PM - 3PM 📍 Location: Student Center Ballrooms ABC/Patio 
 Presented by the University College Academic Programming Team

title: Getting Started with Zotero
description:
Getting Started with Zotero 
 
 Using a citation manager like Zotero to organize your research has numerous advantages, including but not limited to... 
 
 Collect references as you browse the web or databases 
 Organize, highlight, and annotate your PDFs, all in one place 
 Sync between your devices 
 Automatically rename PDF files you've downloaded 
 Generate citations instantly and change style formats with a few clicks 
 
 This is an interactive workshop and will not be recorded. By the end of this workshop, you will be able to import your existing references into the program, collect references from the library databases, and be able to create in-text references and bibliographies with just a few clicks! 
 
 Related LibGuide:  Zotero by Siobhan McCarthy 
 Register Here:  https://montclair.libcal.com/event/15187448

Not sure what major to choose or where your career path is headed? You’re not alone! title: Pride and Progress: Celebrating LGBTQ+ and Disability Journeys
description:
Join Advocacy and Outreach for our 2nd Annual LGBTQ+ and Disability History and Awareness Month Flag Raising and Reception — a joyful celebration of identity, resilience, and community! 
 Pride and Progress brings together students, faculty, and staff to honor the rich histories and vibrant futures of LGBTQ+ and disability communities. Enjoy an inspiring flag-raising ceremony featuring an energetic MC, powerful speakers, and a special live performance you won’t want to miss. 
 After the ceremony, the celebration continues with: - Music & vibes - Delicious food - A hands-on craft activity - A photo activation station - Free LGBTQ+ and Disability Pride flags - Interactive tabling from campus partners 
 This event is about visibility, solidarity, and celebration — open to everyone, including allies! Come as you are, bring your friends, and help us raise our voices (and our flags!) in honor of progress, pride, and community power.

title: To POP OFF or NOT TO POP OFF...
description:
That is the question! 
 Join PM Alexis for a the opportunity to learn more about your emotions, regulation strategies, and more!  We will discuss the long term implications of “popping off”, the psychological science behind “letting it out”, and strategies for remaining calm in the moment.  This event will teach you more about yourself and help you to be a better roommate, partner, and person!  
 Oh, and don’t forget the popcorn bar! We'll have various toppings ranging from Nacho Cheese powder to M&Ms.  
 All students are welcome, commuters need to be signed in a with a resident following Residence Life guest registration procedures.

title: Exploring Within: A Journey of Empowerment & Liberation
description:
Join CAPS, the University Galleries, and Inclusive Excellence in a journey of mindful self-exploration, as we feature the interactive exhibition  The Age of Black Metal  by  Afrotectopia in the opening event of Mental Health Awareness Week 2025! No registration necessary. 
   
   
 ABOUT THE EXHIBITION 
 September 9 – December 14, 2025 
 Segal Gallery and Kasser Lobby 
 Black Metal  originated as a kitchen table art book that pushes the boundaries of space travel, science fiction, speculative design, Black culture, art, technology, and spirituality. The book emerged from an Afrotectopia-led incubator, in collaboration with MIT Media Lab’s Space Exploration Initiative and NYU’s Interactive Telecommunications Program. The project features contributions from artists Jordan Caldwell, Kordae Jatafa Henry, Jeremy Kamal, and Ari Melenciano. 
 The Age of Black Metal  builds upon the foundational ideas of the book and translates the text into a fully immersive experience for visitors to explore each conceptual chapter–from metaphysical training manuals, botanical consciousness, and self-alignment protocols–through participatory installations. The exhibition is set centuries in the future, imagining a timeline where society has been profoundly shaped by the principles of Black Metal. Ultimately, visitors will not only bear witness to the societal effects of Black Metal, but also leave transformed in some way. 
 The Age of Black Metal  invites all to imagine the futures that Black culture can build, if given space to expand without limit. 
 Ari Melenciano  has cultivated an expansive practice within the arts, technology, design, culture, and pedagogy. Her natural ability to combine many disciplines reveals their interconnectedness and reimagines their conventions for new possibilities. Her art practice ranges from using AI through both critical and imaginative lenses, to sound design using botanical data. Her work has been exhibited around the world from Dubai's Museum of the Future to the Studio Museum in Harlem. She's a frequent international public speaker, and occasionally designs and teaches courses at New York University, Hunter College, Parsons, and the Pratt Institute. 
 Afrotectopia  is a social institution cultivating boundless innovation at the nexus of art, design, technology, and culture. Founded in 2018 by NYU ITP graduate student Ari Melenciano, Afrotectopia began as a highly cross-disciplinary conference cultivating a vibrant community of industry and cultural pioneers. For years, Afrotectopia hosted a variety of programming that bridged connections between emerging technologies, Black culture, and racial equity.

title: Khaṅkhaṇā: The Sound of Dancing Feet | The Nrityagram Dance Ensemble
description:
Nrityagram Dance Ensemble, hailed as one of India’s premier Odissi dance companies, has captured the world’s imagination with its extraordinary artistry and profound commitment to the ancient tradition of Odissi. We're excited to bring their performance  Khaṅkhaṇā  to Montclair State University this fall!  Show your student ID at the PEAK desk in the lobby when you arrive for a surprise gift from PEAK! 
   
 The company’s approach is rooted in the traditional Gurukula system, where students and teachers live in close harmony, absorbing not just dance technique but the very spirit of the Guru. The Ensemble’s performances have been described as “mysterious, eternal, and beautiful” by The New York Times, reflecting their ability to transport audiences to realms of magic, devotion, and ethereal beauty. 
   
 With its dedication to blending the wisdom of the past with the vibrancy of the present, Nrityagram continues to inspire awe around the world. Its performances, both ancient and contemporary, invite audiences to witness the timeless dance of love, union, and spiritual transcendence, embodied through the delicate, powerful movements of Odissi. 
   
 To join us, be sure to pick up your free student ticket from the Alexander Kasser Theatre box office or our mobile box office in the student center lobby, Tuesday - Thursday, 11:30 AM to 2:00 PM from September 30th to October 9th. See you there!

title: Power of Latinas Conference: Your Rights, Your Voice, Your Future
description:
LUPE Fund, Inc., New Jersey’s oldest Latina-run organization, is proud to partner with Montclair State University to present  Power of Latinas Conference:  Your Rights, Your Voice, Your Future 
 Join us for a full day of inspiration, empowerment, and connection as we bring together influential Latinas who are shaping the future of  business ,  education , and  public service . Our panel discussions are guided by LUPE Fund’s core pillars:  Educate, Engage, Empower , and  Civic Engagement . 
 Each panel will feature accomplished Latina leaders offering invaluable insights, personal stories, and practical tools for growth. Whether you're an aspiring entrepreneur, student, public servant, or advocate, this conference is designed to elevate your voice and expand your future. 
 ✨ Event highlights include: 
 
 Impactful Panel Discussions 
 Latiné-Owned Brands/Vendors and Federal Resources 
 Valuable Resources & Tools 
 Scholarship & Awards Presentation 
 Networking with Like-Minded Leaders 
 
 While this event centers on uplifting Latinas,  all ethnicities, genders, and allies are welcome . We believe in building a stronger, more inclusive future—together. This event is FREE for our MSU Community.  
 Don’t miss this unique opportunity to be part of a movement empowering the next generation of Latina leaders!

description:

Whether you’re a first-time donor or a seasoned pro, your donation can help replenish critical blood supplies used in emergencies, surgeries, and more. title: Nefesh Mountain
description:
New York–based Progressive Americana group Nefesh Mountain Band has emerged as one of the most boundary-pushing ensembles in roots music. Led by the dynamic husband-and-wife team Eric Lindberg and Doni Zasloff, the band has forged a sound entirely their own—blending Americana, bluegrass, folk, jazz, and blues with masterful songwriting, dazzling instrumentals, and fearless creativity. Hailed for their introspective lyrics and world-class musicianship, Nefesh Mountain takes listeners on a deeply personal journey that reflects their wild spirit, compositional finesse, and unbridled love of music. 
   
 Since forming nearly a decade ago, Nefesh Mountain has been proud and vocal about their Jewish American heritage, becoming one of the first prominent Americana/bluegrass bands to weave Jewish tradition and soul into the rich, diverse tapestry of American roots music. 
   
 Their latest album, Beacons, born out of a cross-country tour and shaped by both personal triumphs and turbulent world events, radiates hope, unity, and adventurous genre-bending. Featuring legendary guests Jerry Douglas, Sam Bush, and Stuart Duncan, the record showcases soaring harmonies, heartfelt ballads, and music that speaks to our shared humanity. From the electrified drive of “This Is Me” to the moving grace of “Better Angels,” Nefesh Mountain offers songs that uplift and inspire—serving as a beacon of light in divided times. 
   
 To join us, be sure to pick up your free student ticket from the Alexander Kasser Theatre box office or our mobile box office in the student center lobby, Tuesday - Thursday, 11:30 AM to 2:00 PM, and show your student ID at the PEAK desk in the lobby when you arrive for a surprise gift from PEAK.

title: Crash-A-Class Fall 2025
description:
Ever wonder what it's like in that class everyone's been talking about? Curious about what you'll learn in different majors across campus? You're in luck! 
   
 Running  Monday, October 13 through Friday, October 17 ,  "Crash-A-Class"  is the perfect opportunity to experience and explore different courses you may consider taking in the future and with Fall 2025 Registration  right around the corner , there's no better time to try!  
   
 LINK WILL BE ADDED HERE ONCE SIGN UPS OPEN 
   
 "Crash-a-Class" is an exclusive opportunity for students to sit in on a class for a day to learn more about specific programs from a seat  right inside  the classroom! Held just before spring registration, this program offers students a chance to try out a class  before  registering for it for the coming semester! Like what you've learned? Consider trying out another course in the same subject or speaking with your academic advisor to learn more about adding it to your academic plan!  
   
 "Crash-a-Class" is a free program hosted by University College in collaboration with all of the unrestricted, undergraduate Colleges and Schools on campus. There is no fee or penalty to attend or participate. Students participating in "Crash-a-Class"  will not be excused from their regularly scheduled classes  to attend a course they've registered to "crash."

title: Safe Space Training
description:
Our Safe Space Training is an intensive, interactive training that provides attendees with information and tools to combat homophobia, biphobia, transphobia, cissexism and heterosexism, on campus and beyond. Through interactive activities and discussion, participants will personally reflect on their own experiences to enhance their personal and professional development, provide further education, and finally, identify ways to create change on campus and beyond. 
 All sessions are three hours and are first-come, first-served. Pre-registration is required. Registrants are expected to attend the full session. Only individuals who have fully completed the Safe Space Program and have agreed to the expectations of its membership are able to display the sticker/button of our program. Refreshments are not provided; however, you are more than welcome to bring your lunch, coffee, snacks, etc.

title: Black Metal Film Screening
description:
This special screening of the film adaptation of  Black Metal  is followed by a discussion with artist and curator Ari Melenciano. 
 
 
 ABOUT THE EXHIBITION Segal Gallery and Kasser Lobby September 9 – December 14, 2025 
 Black Metal  originated as a kitchen table art book that pushes the boundaries of space travel, science fiction, speculative design, Black culture, art, technology, and spirituality. The book emerged from an Afrotectopia-led incubator, in collaboration with MIT Media Lab’s Space Exploration Initiative and NYU’s Interactive Telecommunications Program. The project features contributions from artists Jordan Caldwell, Kordae Jatafa Henry, Jeremy Kamal, and Ari Melenciano. 
 The Age of Black Metal  builds upon the foundational ideas of the book and translates the text into a fully immersive experience for visitors to explore each conceptual chapter–from metaphysical training manuals, botanical consciousness, and self-alignment protocols–through participatory installations. The exhibition is set centuries in the future, imagining a timeline where society has been profoundly shaped by the principles of Black Metal. Ultimately, visitors will not only bear witness to the societal effects of Black Metal, but also leave transformed in some way.

title: Magnificent Bird / Book of Travelers | Two Song Cycles written and performed by Gabriel Kahane
description:
Experience two distinct works by acclaimed songwriter and performer Gabriel Kahane in one unforgettable day.  
   
 In this duo of intimate solo musical plays, composer Gabriel Kahane blends songwriting and storytelling for a singular, poignant theatrical event. Book of Travelers recounts the strangers he met on a 9,000-mile train journey through a divided America, and Magnificent Bird chronicles a year he spent entirely off-line, and the unexpected turbulence of living quietly. Performed on alternating nights, these two concept albums offer a relentless self-inquiry, and a searing portrait of a world in flux.  To join us, be sure to pick up your free student ticket from the Alexander Kasser Theatre box office or our mobile box office in the student center lobby, Tuesday - Thursday, 11:30 AM to 2:00 PM, and show your student ID at the PEAK desk in the lobby when you arrive for a surprise gift from PEAK. 
   
 Hailed as “one of the finest songwriters of the day” by The New Yorker, Gabriel Kahane is a musician and storyteller whose work spans the theater, club, and concert hall. Highlights of the 2024-25 season include a return to the New York stage in a production at Playwrights Horizons, performances at the Philharmonie de Paris, Wigmore Hall, and the Concertgebouw with fellow composer/performer Caroline Shaw, the premiere of a clarinet concerto for Anthony McGill, a solo debut with the Orchestre National de Lyon, and Kahane’s San Francisco conducting debut in Carla Kihlstedt’s Twenty-six Little Deaths. Kahane's collaborators range from Phoebe Bridgers, Paul Simon, Sufjan Stevens, and Sylvan Esso, to the Danish String Quartet, Roomful of Teeth, and Attacca Quartet. As a writer, he has been published by The New Yorker online and The New York Times; a newsletter and collection of essays on music, literature, and politics can be found at  gabrielkahane.substack.com . 
   
 4:00 pm Magnificent Bird 
 Run Time:  74 minutes, no intermission. 
   
 Magnificent Bird, is an intimate reflection on a year of self-imposed isolation during which the artist set out to write a song every day. With contributions from Andrew Bird, Chris Thile, Amelia Meath (Sylvan Esso), and Pulitzer Prize- winning composer Caroline Shaw, this collection explores the delicate balance between personal introspection and global crises. It’s a vivid musical snapshot of life during a tumultuous period, offering both a personal and universal meditation on modern-day existence. Based on Kahane’s fifth LP. 
   
 7:00 pm - Book of Travelers 
 Run Time:  70 minutes, no intermission 
   
 In Book of Travelers, Gabriel Kahane embarks on a journey across the United States, exploring the intersections of American identity and personal connection through the people he meets along the way. This powerful and emotional piece blends folk, classical, and pop influences to create a nuanced reflection on contemporary life in America. The work is a poignant and intimate exploration of what it means to traverse a country at a crossroads.

title: I AM | Camille A. Brown & Dancers
description:
Five-time Tony nominated choreographer and director Camille A. Brown deepens her explorations of Black joy in Camille A. Brown & Dancers’  I AM . With captivating live and original music,  I AM  launches new queries into the possibilities of imagination—and boldly investigates the future. Inspired by a narrative within HBO’s  Lovecraft Country  and the rhythms of the movie  Drumline , Brown’s 2025 New York Times Critics’ Pick breaks boundaries and “takes her signature interweaving of African diasporic dance forms to new heights.” —  The New York Times 
   
  To join us, be sure to pick up your free student ticket from the Alexander Kasser Theatre box office or our mobile box office in the student center lobby, Tuesdays and Thursdays, 11:30 AM to 2:00 PM, and show your student ID at the PEAK desk in the lobby when you arrive for a surprise gift from PEAK.

title: Rent In Concert | Musical in Concert | Produced by AMP Worldwide
description:
Experience the iconic music of  RENT  like never before. In this sweeping symphonic concert produced by AMP Worldwide, a powerhouse ensemble of vocalists and instrumentalists brings Jonathan Larson’s groundbreaking rock musical to life in a sweeping symphonic concert. Featuring the full score—including “Seasons of Love,” “La Vie Bohème,” and “Take Me or Leave Me”—this electrifying performance celebrates the enduring spirit of love, loss, and chosen family. 
   
 Set in New York City’s East Village at the height of the HIV/AIDS crisis,  RENT  follows a group of young artists as they chase their dreams, navigate heartbreak, and fight to live—and love—fully in the moment. Winner of the Tony Award for Best Musical and the Pulitzer Prize for Drama,  RENT  remains a cultural touchstone with music that resonates across generations. 
   
 To join us, be sure to pick up your free student ticket from the Alexander Kasser Theatre box office or our mobile box office in the student center lobby, Tuesdays and Thursdays, 11:30 AM to 2:00 PM, and show your student ID at the PEAK desk in the lobby when you arrive for a surprise gift from PEAK.
